meanings.sent1: The judge was legitimatizing the contract.
meanings.sent2: The government was legitimatizing the new law.
meanings.sent3: The cat was legitimatizing its ownership of the couch by napping on it.
meanings.sent4: The sun legitimatizing the flowers with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was legitimatizing the students' excuses for being late.

meanings.definition: To give official approval or recognition to.
meanings.sent1: The committee was legitimatizing the new club on campus.
meanings.sent2: The city council was legitimatizing the construction project.
meanings.sent3: The dog was legitimatizing the mailman as a friend.
meanings.sent4: The spotlight legitimatizing the lead singer's presence on stage.
meanings.sent5: The principal was legitimatizing the student council's decision.
